segment.source: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments namespace, you can create and manage appointments in a user's calendar app.
segment.target: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments namespace, you can create and manage appointments in a user's calendar app.

segment.source: Manage appointments
segment.target: Manage appointments

segment.source: Manage appointments
segment.target: Manage appointments

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments namespace, you can create and manage appointments in a user's calendar app.
segment.target: Through the Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments namespace, you can create and manage appointments in a user's calendar app.

segment.source: Here, we'll show you how to create an appointment, add it to a calendar app, replace it in the calendar app, and remove it from the calendar app.
segment.target: Here, we'll show you how to create an appointment, add it to a calendar app, replace it in the calendar app, and remove it from the calendar app.

segment.source: We'll also show how to display a time span for a calendar app and create an appointment-recurrence object.
segment.target: We'll also show how to display a time span for a calendar app and create an appointment-recurrence object.

segment.source: Create an appointment and apply data to it
segment.target: Create an appointment and apply data to it

segment.source: Create a Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments.Appointment object and assign it to a variable.
segment.target: Create a Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments.Appointment object and assign it to a variable.

segment.source: Then, apply to the Appointment the appointment properties that were supplied through the UI by a user.
segment.target: Then, apply to the Appointment the appointment properties that were supplied through the UI by a user.

segment.source: Add an appointment to the user's calendar
segment.target: Add an appointment to the user's calendar

segment.source: Create a Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments.Appointment object and assign it to a variable.
segment.target: Create a Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments.Appointment object and assign it to a variable.

segment.source: Then, call the AppointmentManager.ShowAddAppointmentAsync(Appointment, Rect, Placement) method to show the default appointments provider add-appointment UI, to enable the user to add an appointment.
segment.target: Then, call the AppointmentManager.ShowAddAppointmentAsync(Appointment, Rect, Placement) method to show the default appointments provider add-appointment UI, to enable the user to add an appointment.

segment.source: If the user clicked Add, the sample prints the appointment identifier that ShowAddAppointmentAsync returned.
segment.target: If the user clicked Add, the sample prints the appointment identifier that ShowAddAppointmentAsync returned.

segment.source: Note For Windows Phone Store apps, ShowAddAppointment functions just like ShowEditNewAppointment in that the dialog displayed for adding the appointment is editable.
segment.target: Note For Windows Phone Store apps, ShowAddAppointment functions just like ShowEditNewAppointment in that the dialog displayed for adding the appointment is editable.

segment.source: Replace an appointment in the user's calendar
segment.target: Replace an appointment in the user's calendar

segment.source: Create a Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments.Appointment object and assign it to a variable.
segment.target: Create a Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments.Appointment object and assign it to a variable.

segment.source: Then, call the appropriate AppointmentManager.ShowReplaceAppointmentAsync method to show the default appointments provider replace-appointment UI to enable the user to replace an appointment.
segment.target: Then, call the appropriate AppointmentManager.ShowReplaceAppointmentAsync method to show the default appointments provider replace-appointment UI to enable the user to replace an appointment.

segment.source: The user also provides the appointment identifier that they want to replace.
segment.target: The user also provides the appointment identifier that they want to replace.

segment.source: This identifier was returned from AppointmentManager.ShowAddAppointmentAsync.
segment.target: This identifier was returned from AppointmentManager.ShowAddAppointmentAsync.

segment.source: If the user clicked Replace, the sample prints that it updated that appointment identifier.
segment.target: If the user clicked Replace, the sample prints that it updated that appointment identifier.

segment.source: Remove an appointment from the user's calendar
segment.target: Remove an appointment from the user's calendar

segment.source: Call the appropriate AppointmentManager.ShowRemoveAppointmentAsync method to show the default appointments provider remove-appointment UI, to enable the user to remove an appointment.
segment.target: Call the appropriate AppointmentManager.ShowRemoveAppointmentAsync method to show the default appointments provider remove-appointment UI, to enable the user to remove an appointment.

segment.source: The user also provides the appointment identifier that they want to remove.
segment.target: The user also provides the appointment identifier that they want to remove.

segment.source: This identifier was returned from AppointmentManager.ShowAddAppointmentAsync.
segment.target: This identifier was returned from AppointmentManager.ShowAddAppointmentAsync.

segment.source: If the user clicked Delete, the sample prints that it removed the appointment specified by that appointment identifier.
segment.target: If the user clicked Delete, the sample prints that it removed the appointment specified by that appointment identifier.

segment.source: Show a time span for the appointments provider
segment.target: Show a time span for the appointments provider

segment.source: Call the AppointmentManager.ShowTimeFrameAsync method to show a specific time span for the default appointments provider's primary UI if the user clicked Show.
segment.target: Call the AppointmentManager.ShowTimeFrameAsync method to show a specific time span for the default appointments provider's primary UI if the user clicked Show.

segment.source: The sample prints that the default appointments provider appeared on screen.
segment.target: The sample prints that the default appointments provider appeared on screen.

segment.source: Create an appointment-recurrence object and apply data to it
segment.target: Create an appointment-recurrence object and apply data to it

segment.source: Create an Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments.AppointmentRecurrence object and assign it to a variable.
segment.target: Create an Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointments.AppointmentRecurrence object and assign it to a variable.

segment.source: Then, apply to the AppointmentRecurrence the recurrence properties that were supplied through the UI by a user.
segment.target: Then, apply to the AppointmentRecurrence the recurrence properties that were supplied through the UI by a user.

segment.source: Add a new editable appointment
segment.target: Add a new editable appointment

segment.source: ShowEditNewAppointmentAsync works just like ShowAddAppointmentAsync except that the dialog for adding the appointment is editable so that the user can modify the appointment data before saving it.
segment.target: ShowEditNewAppointmentAsync works just like ShowAddAppointmentAsync except that the dialog for adding the appointment is editable so that the user can modify the appointment data before saving it.

segment.source: Show appointment details
segment.target: Show appointment details

segment.source: ShowAppointmentDetailsAsync causes the system to show details for the specified appointment.
segment.target: ShowAppointmentDetailsAsync causes the system to show details for the specified appointment.

segment.source: An app that implements app calendars may choose to be activated to show details for appointments in calendars it owns.
segment.target: An app that implements app calendars may choose to be activated to show details for appointments in calendars it owns.

segment.source: Otherwise, the system will show the appointment details.
segment.target: Otherwise, the system will show the appointment details.

segment.source: An overload of the method that accepts a start date argument is provided to show details for an instance of a recurring appointment.
segment.target: An overload of the method that accepts a start date argument is provided to show details for an instance of a recurring appointment.

segment.source: Summary and next steps
segment.target: Summary and next steps

segment.source: Now you have a basic understanding of how to manage appointments.
segment.target: Now you have a basic understanding of how to manage appointments.

segment.source: Download the Universal Windows app samples from GitHub to see more examples of how to manage appointments.
segment.target: Download the Universal Windows app samples from GitHub to see more examples of how to manage appointments.

segment.target: Related topics
